tweets.text:
Update for #Worcestershire. The floodgate at Dunns Lane, #Upton-upon-Severn is closed.

Keep checking your #flood risk https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/GijTPSSGFo

We‚Äôve removed the #flood warnings for Mill Beck/Welham Road and the River Derwent at #Norton. Groundwater flooding continues to be managed through pumping operations. Flood alerts remain in place as flooding of roads and land may still be possible: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/5zHeHiZWfm

We are excited to announce the launch of a ¬£2.5m scheme in Stafford that will alleviate flooding, boost wildlife & improve public connections to wildlife. A recent grant of ¬£150,000 from @HighwaysEngland has helped boost the project. Working with @Staffordbc & @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nZJYNrcggH
Wet, muddy, cold but brilliant day winching big timber in a steep woodland! Really excited about this #nfm project near Staveley #LakeDistrict for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/gc4a1UgPon

We have been about the ward a few times today to check in on the River Hope #SS17. There are concerns locally, and understandably so. 
@thurrockcouncil has confirmed that @EnvAgencySE are out looking at the situation and council is awaiting the report back. 1/4

Could beavers be a #NatureBasedSolution to attenuate flow in the StARR catchment?  New report supports principle: https://t.co/ZUZ3aU2xlJ  #NaturesEngineers @CornwallBeaver @CwallWildlife @WestcountryRT @CornwallCouncil @EnvAgencySW @UniofExeterESI @SouthWestWater https://t.co/8OSnswM9ob

With more rain expected to fall on already saturated ground overnight, we expect river levels in some of our upper river catchments to rise. Keep up to speed with the latest #flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/nUHvBSlOyX

This is one of the @EnvAgencyYNE #Reservoirs on the #RiverRother near #Chesterfield.

The levels have pretty much peaked across the top ends of the catchment after some heavy rain overnight and this morning.

Levels across the top & middle of the catchments have peaked & falling. https://t.co/3bTNg8hsUO

urls.title: Massive new flood gate fitted in York
urls.description: The new gate will be air-lifted in place as part of ¬£38 million Foss Barrier upgrade.

urls.title: Recovery work begins after heavy flooding in Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire
urls.description: Operations are underway to help communities across Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire recover from flooding following the severe weather brought by Storm Christoph last week.

tweets.text:

tweets.text: A new sediment trap funded through #DoingMorefortheDerwent is now in place! urls.title: NFU calls for urgent action on integrated water management in report
urls.description: The NFU's Integrated Water Management report sets out why a long-term, collaborative approach is required to improve Britain's water infrastructure to better cope with extreme weather events from flooding to drought.

tweets.text:
Significant investment in #WaterInfrastructure is crucial to:

üåä Protecting farmland during extreme weather events.
üçû Increasing our food security.
üåè Delivering the NFU‚Äôs ambition for farming to be #NetZero by 2040.

Find out more in out new report https://t.co/t8dqOD8wMN https://t.co/ckpynTVtUf

urls.title: Welcome! You are invited to join a webinar: Flood & Coast | Session 3: The new era of digital innovation in FCERM. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: On this page you can register for the third out of four digital sessions of Flood & Coast. Registration deadline: 29 Jan 2021 Please note that the event will NOT be hosted in Zoom, we are only using this platform for registrations. A confirmation email including a calendar invite will be sent to you within 24 hours. Information about how to join the session will be sent by the 1st of February 2021. The price per session is ¬£25.00 + VAT (total: ¬£30.00) The payment system is supported by PayPal, but you don't need a PayPal account, you can simply use your debit or credit card to checkout. Click on "Pay and Register", then press the "Continue to PayPal" button. A new window will pop up asking you to either log into your PayPal account or to simply pay by debit or credit card (no PayPal account required, just click on "continue as guest" and add an email address where the receipt should be sent to). For any queries please email info@floodandcoast.com.

tweets.text:
Why attend session 3? 

Simon Leek of @atkinsglobal puts it perfectly..."...the application and adoption of digital innovation and technology is fundamental to delivering the ambitions...of the @EnvAgency's new flood strategy". 

Book your place: https://t.co/eCMtlXsZoR https://t.co/vtO85ZEdBL
